title: Bulk Suspicion: Typo In Geofence Warrant Created Two-Mile Long Dragnet
description: We’ve expressed our displeasure with geofence warrants multiple times. I’ve often referred to them as “reverse” warrants, a term that implies how these warrants invert probable cause. Those in the business of protecting rights (ACLU, EFF) aren’t fans of that term, but it is useful shorthand. Rather than show a court probable cause exists to […]

title: Techdirt 2023: The Stats
description: Every year a little after New Years, I do a post about the previous year of Techdirt traffic and comments, looking at what people were interested in, what commenters were highly rated, etc. I know most sites put this out towards the end of the year, but I remain a purist and wait until after […]

title: Court: Being Portrayed As A Bigot By An NBA Team, Yelled At By An NBA Player Isn’t Actionable
description: Even though the blog is now often given over to “Trump did nothing wrong” posts and suggestions that social media services engage in “censorship” of so-called “conservatives” (and don’t even think about wandering into the comment section), Eugene Volokh’s Volokh Conspiracy still surfaces some very interesting cases. And this one has a lot going on. […]

title: Daily Deal: uTalk Language Learning
description: With more than 2,500 words and phrases to learn in each of our 150+ languages, the uTalk gives you a running start on your journey to language fluency. Simple and easy to use, you have fun as you develop your language skills naturally – just like you did with your first language. Every single word […]

title: Free Speech Experts Realizing Just How Big A Free Speech Hypocrite Elon Is
description: On Monday, Elon Musk tweeted “To fear parody or criticism is a sign of weakness.” If true, then this is Elon admitting to an astounding level of weakness. I mean, we’ve been chronicling for nearly two years now how Elon Musk talks a good game on free speech, but at every opportunity he’s had, he […]

title: Americans Received 55 Million Robocalls In 2023, A 9% Jump From 2022
description: It’s extremely weird that we’ve somehow normalized the fact that scammers, scumbags, debt collectors, and marketers have made the U.S.’ primary voice communication platform largely unusable. There is some good news: according to data from the YouMail Robocall Index, U.S. consumers received just under 3.8 billion robocalls during the month of December, a 16.3% decrease […]
